definition: tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly

sentences.english: Several strong men eventually moved her away and calmed her down, although she sputtered and fumed for quite a while.
sentences.chinese: 末了，几个强壮的男人把她挪走，也让她冷静下来。

sentences.english: At the world's end, God is going to destroy everything that He has created.
sentences.chinese: 在世界末了时，上帝会毁灭他所造的一切。

sentences.english: In the gospels Jesus predicts the end of the world and the coming of the kingdom of God.
sentences.chinese: 在福音书中，耶稣预言世界的末了，以及神国的降临。

sentences.english: 22In fact, none of the seven left any children. Last of all, the woman died too.
sentences.chinese: 那七个人都没有留下孩子，末了，那妇人也死了。

sentences.english: This is Ripley, last survivor of the Nostromo, signing off.
sentences.chinese: 我是雷普利，“诺史莫”号的末了幸存者，完毕。

sentences.english: Christ is coming again to receive His believers to Himself.
sentences.chinese: 在这世代的末了，基督要回来提接祂的众肢体。

sentences.english: And finally, I want to express our deep appreciation to our Chinese hosts.
sentences.chinese: 末了，我志愿对我们的中国东道主表示诚挚的谢忱。

sentences.english: Small spring and radiograph is applied to paper, in the end.
sentences.chinese: 小弹簧及牙片，末了功用到纸张。

sentences.english: The lair conditioningk of hard page-turn control keys may frustrconsumedleft-handed readvertising cwimpaigners.
sentences.chinese: 末了，没有翻页按键给左撇子带来未便。

sentences.english: Tomorrow's the deadline for choosing classes.
sentences.chinese: 明天未来诰日是选课的末了刻日。

sentences.english: You should be working on the last question by now.
sentences.chinese: 目下现古您们该当正在做末了一讲题了。

sentences.english: Bruce answered all the questions excepting the last one.
sentences.chinese: 除了末了一个问题外，布鲁斯都答出来了。

sentences.english: The workers tend to start the fining finishing now.
sentences.chinese: 工人们如今打算首先末了的抹光作业。

sentences.english: I am unlucky enough to miss the last train.
sentences.chinese: 我真晦气，错过了末了一班火车。

sentences.english: Then, when there is time more plastering.
sentences.chinese: 末了，有空时在再涂上更多的灰泥。

sentences.english: When accessorizing always take off the last thing you put on.
sentences.chinese: 用配饰，永远把末了戴上的东西拿上去。

definition: in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
to make a show of being very much in earnest (idiom)/to act as if one is taking things very seriously
see 煞有介事[sha4 you3 jie4 shi4]
